document_data.name: Orsraun Mountains
document_data.mainbody: The '''Orsraun Mountains''' were the largest range of mountains south of the [[Spine of the World]].

Geography.Mountains of the Alaoreum: The northeastern mountains were known as the [[Mountains of the Alaoreum]] and were separated from the rest of the range by [[Treefall Pass]]. The Alaoreum were ostensibly the demesne of the [[dwarves]] of [[Ironfang Deep]]
Geography.The Orbrekh: The [[Orbrekh]] was a thin part of the range separated by a river valley that was comfortably controlled by around thirty to thirty-five [[hill giant]]s.

Inhabitants.[[Ancient Ax]]: A tribe of [[Goblin]]s who desired to conquer Ironfang.
Inhabitants.[[Candlekairn]]: A clan of [[orc]]s who lived in the shadow of Mount Andrus. The vast majority were killed when that volcano erupted in [[517 DR]] and many of those who survived were captured after they tried to occupy the ruins of [[Dauntshield]].<ref>
Inhabitants.[[Emberspeak]]: An adult [[red dragon]] who preyed on caravan traffic in the Shining Plains.
Inhabitants.[[Onusclan]]: A tribe of orcs who occupied the northern peaks and were led by a "King Highstead".
Inhabitants.[[Community of the high brows]]: Led by a shaman named [[Oogle]], the Orbrekh range was considered relatively safe thanks to these giants.
Inhabitants.[[Shard (organization)|The Shard]]: An [[ogre]] clan led by [[Londa Ironhead]] who hired themselves out as mercenaries and were known for lining the edges of their weapons with [[obsidian]]. It is thought that the clan was wiped out in a battle with multiple red dragons some time in the 1360s DR.<ref>
Inhabitants.[[Tattered Cloth Legion]]:
A clan of [[kobold]]s from the southern peaks.

[[Harper]] agents also reported a pair of [[black dragon]]s living in the westernmost mountains in [[1367 DR]]<ref>{{Cite dragon/210/The Serpent Blade}}. Rumors placed a mated pair of [[brass dragon]]s in the eastern foothills<ref> and at least one [[copper dragon]] was claimed to lair in the Orsrauns as well.<ref>

Notable Locations.[[Mount Andrus]]:
An active volcano rumored to be the home of a great and evil entity. These rumors attracted [[Church of Talos|Talassans]] who came to inhabit the mountain.{{Cite web/Dragon Features Archive|url=http://forum.candlekeep.com/topic.asp?TOPIC_ID=10705|title=Spellplague: The Wailing Years|author=[[Brian R. James]]|date=2008-02-27|accessdate=2008-04-14}}

A major, yet secret temple to [[Grumbar]] was located somewhere in the Orsrauns.<ref>
